productDescription: Handcrafted sourdough bread using traditional fermentation methods
storageType: Store at room temperature, consume within 5 days
mainIngredients: Wheat flour, water, salt, sourdough starter

product.key_ingredients: Wheat flour, water, salt, sourdough starter
product.cooking_required: No cooking required - ready to eat

process_steps.step_description: Combine flour, water, salt, and starter
Divide and shape dough into loaves
Final proof in bannetons for 12-16 hours
Cool on wire racks for minimum 2 hours
Package in paper bags once cooled
Deliver to retail or direct sale

hazard_analysis.hazards: Survival of pathogens due to inadequate heat treatment
hazard_analysis.control_measure_description: Minimum internal temperature of 90°C achieved through baking at 230°C for minimum 35 minutes

ccp_summary.hazard: Survival of pathogens due to inadequate heat treatment
ccp_summary.critical_limit: Internal temperature ≥90°C; Bake time ≥35 minutes at 230°C
ccp_summary.monitoring: Check oven temperature display; probe internal temp of sample loaves
ccp_summary.corrective_action: Extend baking time; reject under-baked product; recalibrate oven
ccp_summary.verification: Daily oven calibration check; weekly probe thermometer verification
ccp_summary.records: Baking log with time, temperature, operator initials

full_plan.team_scope_summary: The HACCP team at Golden Test Bakery consists of the Head Baker (HACCP Team Leader), Production Manager, and Quality Assurance Officer. The scope covers all sourdough bread production from ingredient receipt to final product dispatch.
full_plan.process_description: Artisan sourdough bread is produced using a traditional long-fermentation method. The process begins with receiving quality-assured flour and maintaining an active sourdough starter. Dough is mixed, bulk fermented, shaped, and cold-proofed before baking at high temperature. Products are cooled and packaged for same-day or next-day sale.
full_plan.verification_procedures:
1. Daily pre-operational checks of equipment and facilities
2. Weekly review of monitoring records by HACCP Team Leader
3. Monthly internal audit of HACCP system compliance
4. Annual third-party verification audit
5. Quarterly review of corrective actions and trend analysis
full_plan.record_keeping: All HACCP-related records are maintained for a minimum of 2 years. Records include: daily production logs, temperature monitoring charts, cleaning schedules, supplier certificates, training records, and corrective action reports. Records are stored securely and made available for regulatory inspection.
